intro: Micromeria frivaldszkyana, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to extreme drought conditions. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small, clustered flowers. Micromeria frivaldszkyana is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
